__e: When you have your first kid at seventeen with the only man you've ever kissed in your life, and then another kid when you're nineteen, with the same man, and you live in a trailer in your Mom's backyard, and your Dad's been in jail for ten years, you never have time to think.
It's the first time when they're not in their mom's car, they're not in Mom's living room, they're not in Mom's backyard.
Well, then what was he doing standing in my front yard?
Won't let the past in my yard again.
But this is somebody's backyard, isn't it?
He was out of control when I was... I was standing at the back of the house. I was looking out across this field.
But then you must tell me what you were doing tonight in the priest's garden.
Which means that at some point, that night, he was in the Captain's yard, right?
Plus, it seems safer than doin' it in the guy's backyard.
And who'll play catch Out in the back with our kid?
He's safe at home in the backyard with his Ma.
It's got a yard with a little patch of dirt in it.
He wants to see me, in the backyard.
Crawl! What the hell are we doing here in someone else's backyard?
Oh, God, I'm... I'm so sorry. I keep telling her to stay out of other people's yards.
I know that I'm not the handiest guy, but I'm still a man. And I want to be able to look out into my yard and say...
When you get home tonight, will you just go out in your backyard and just look up and see if you see anything?
That's their backyard... and no, we can't... because we have way too much work to do.
